Detailed Description

Author:
Xiangyu Hu <Xiangyu.Hu@aer.mw.tum.de>

Function Documentation

int main ( int  argc,
char *  argv[] 
)

The main program.

Starts the initialization methods and contains the main computation loop

Parameters:
argc The number of command line arguments, should be two: program name (by default) and project name
argv The command line arguments array: by default program name at first position (index 0), and then the project( which is specified when calling the program name (e.g. s./sph ../cases/couette) at index 1


below the rough structure of the main function:

initializations

  • global initialization (by defining an object of class Initiation (initialization "automatically" done at this moment (from .cfg or .rst file) by constructor method of Initiation class. That is by the way the reason why the initiation::initiation method does not figure in the call grapf of the main function (constructors are not shwon there)

  • initiate the weight function

  • initiate the Moving Least Squares approximation

  • initiate the particle manager

  • create materials, forces and real particles

  • initiate boundary conditions and boundary particles

  • initialize the time solver

  • initialize output class (should be the last to be initialized)


computation loop starts

  • call the time slover (who iterates over one output time interval)

  • output results after a time interval
